intro: Cerbera manghas var. samoensis, commonly known as the Samoan mangosteen, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces bright red, fleshy fruits that are edible and have a sweet, tangy flavor. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and requires a warm, tropical climate. Due to its ornamental value and fruit production, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and tropical regions.
